evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Efficacy analyses for the final CSR focus on secondary efficacy endpoints (Section 8.2) based on patients' long-term follow-up data.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: It is noted that the primary efficacy analysis (Section 8.1) was completed in the 1st CSR.

evaluation_table.reasoning: The Original SAP (Version 3.0) states the primary analysis was *already* completed in the 1st CSR. The Generated SAP describes it as a planned future event. This reflects a difference in the document version/timing context.

evaluation_table.component: Primary Endpoint Analysis in Final CSR
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: In the final CSR, the analysis for the primary efficacy endpoint will be performed as a sensitivity analysis using the same method as 1st CSR.

evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP treats the primary endpoint analysis in this document as a sensitivity analysis (since the primary analysis was done in 1st CSR). Generated SAP treats it as the main primary analysis.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Efficacy will be assessed by response evaluation and time-to-event analyses.

evaluation_table.protocol_text: Efficacy will be assessed by response evaluation and time-to-event analyses.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Response evaluation will be based on tumor responses measured and recorded by using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: as determined by an Independent Tumor Review Committee (central review) using RECIST v.1.1.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Tumor responses will be measured and recorded by using RECIST v.1.1.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The primary endpoint, ORR during the Induction Study Period, and the secondary endpoint, ORR during the Whole Study Period, will be determined by the BOR.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The primary efficacy endpoint is the Objective Response Rate (ORR), defined as the proportion of patients achieving a Best Overall Response (BOR)...
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The primary endpoint, ORR during the Induction Study Period, and the secondary endpoint, ORR during the Whole Study Period, will be determined by the best overall response (BOR).

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: For CR or PR, BOR must be confirmed by the subsequent assessment.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: In the final CSR, the analysis for the protocol-specified primary efficacy endpoint will be performed as a sensitivity analysis using method described in this section.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The primary efficacy endpoint is ORR based on BOR during the Induction Study Period by RECIST version 1.1 (Appendix 14.5).
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The primary efficacy endpoint is the Objective Response Rate (ORR), defined as the proportion of patients achieving a Best Overall Response (BOR) of either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) during the Induction Study Period (up to Cycle 6) as determined by an Independent Tumor Review Committee (central review) using RECIST v.1.1.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The primary efficacy endpoint will be the ORR based on BOR during the Induction Study Period by RECIST v.1.1

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The ORR is defined as the proportion of patients with a confirmed BOR of CR or PR (the 'responder').
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The primary efficacy endpoint is the Objective Response Rate (ORR), defined as the proportion of patients achieving a Best Overall Response (BOR) of either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Objective response rate will be calculated as the number of patients with a response of CR or PR divided by the number of patients in the corresponding population.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: All other patients in the ITT or PP population except responders will be considered as non-responder including patients without post-baseline tumor assessment.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients with no post-baseline tumor assessment or whose response cannot be evaluated (NE) will be treated as non-responders for the primary analysis.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The similarity criterion has been set such that the confidence limits of the 95% CI of the difference in ORR from each treatment group will be entirely bounded by the interval (-12.5, 12.5).
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Therapeutic similarity will be concluded if the 2-sided 95% CI for the difference in ORR is entirely contained within the equivalence margin of (-12.5%, 12.5%).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The similarity criterion has been set such that the confidence limits of the 95% CI of the difference in ORR will be entirely bounded by the interval (-12.5, 12.5).

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The primary analysis for the primary endpoint will be performed utilizing a logistic regression model considering country, sex (female vs. male), disease status at baseline (recurrence vs. metastatic), and ECOG performance status at baseline (0 vs. 1) as covariates with treatment groups (CT-P16 and EU-Approved Avastin) as a fixed effect.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The model will include treatment group as a fixed effect. Covariates will include the stratification factors: sex (female vs. male), disease status (recurrence vs. metastatic), and ECOG performance score (0 vs. 1). Country will be included as a covariate
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The primary analysis for the primary endpoint will be performed utilizing a logistic regression model considering covariates with treatment groups (CT-P16 and EU-Approved Avastin) as a fixed effect

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Country can be pooled into region (EMEA vs. America vs. Asia) for statistical analysis when there are not enough patients within each country.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Country will be included as a covariate unless there are sparse data across centers/countries, in which case it may be pooled by region.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The Delta Method for estimating difference of proportion is explained in the following process.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The resulting odds ratio and its 95% CI will be converted into a difference in proportions (CT-P16 – EU-Approved Avastin) using the Delta method.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The resulting odds ratio and 95% CI will be converted into difference of proportions using the Delta method for the purpose of comparison.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Gen SAP mentions Delta method but omits the detailed mathematical steps. This is acceptable as the method is standard.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: (1) The individual odds and standard errors (SEs) for both treatments will be obtained from the model.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: For the purposes of this algorithm, let the estimate of the odds of being a responder in the CT-P16 group be denoted by $\theta_a$ and the estimate of the odds of being a responder in the EU-Approved Avastin group be denoted by $\theta_b$.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: (2) Calculate the variances of these estimates, $Var(\theta_a)$ and $Var(\theta_b)$ respectively from the SEs obtained from the model.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: (3) Calculate the estimates of the corresponding proportions, denoted $p_a$ and $p_b$ respectively, for each of the randomized treatment groups, from the estimated odds $\theta_a$ and $\theta_b$ using the following formula: $p = \frac{\theta}{1 + \theta}$ and hence calculate the estimate of the difference of proportions $p_a - p_b$.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: (4) Using Taylor expansions and the Delta method, the following formula for approximation can be obtained: $Var[f(X)] \approx (f'(E[X]))^2Var[X]$ Applying this approximation specifically to this case, and using the formula specified in step (3) we obtain the formula $Var(p) = \frac{Var(\theta)}{(1+\theta)^4}$ which should be used to calculate $Var(p_a)$ and $Var(p_b)$.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: (5) Calculate the variance of the difference in proportions $Var(p_a - p_b)$ as the sum of $Var(p_a)$ and $Var(p_b)$.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Use this to obtain the SE of the difference, and hence calculate the 95% CI using the formula: $95\% \text{ Confidence Interval } = (p_a - p_b) +/- 1.96(SE(p_a - p_b))$
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Note: this method assumes that the estimate ORR of CT-P16 group is independent of the estimate of EU-Approved Avastin group.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null

evaluation_table.protocol_text: ORR based on BOR during the Whole Study Period by RECIST v.1.1

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Any patient without any tumor assessment during the study will be censored at the date of randomization.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: No event and no anticancer therapy -> Last tumor assessment date
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients alive and without PD at the time of data cutoff/study completion will be censored at the date of the last adequate tumor assessment.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: if a patient has no event, it will be calculated censoring at the date of last adequate radiological assessment

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Initiation of New anticancer therapy -> Last tumor assessment date before anticancer therapy
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients starting a new anti-cancer therapy prior to PD will be censored at the date of the last adequate tumor assessment prior to the start of the new therapy.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: If a patient receives another new anticancer therapy, it will be censored at the date of adequate radiological assessment... before starting another anticancer therapy.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Event after missing two or more tumor assessment* -> Last tumor assessment date before event
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: If PD or death occurs after missing two or more consecutive scheduled tumor assessments, the patient will be censored at the date of the last adequate tumor assessment prior to the missing visits.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: If disease progression or death is documented after missing two or more tumor assessments, the patient will be censored for PFS at the date of their last adequate tumor assessment

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The last tumor assessment date on which tumor assessment's is neither ‘missing' nor ‘NE' will be used for censoring date.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: last adequate tumor assessment

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: * If there is only one missing tumor assessment before an event, then it will be considered as an event case. Otherwise, it will be considered as a censoring case.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.protocol_text: If disease progression or death is documented after missing one tumor assessment, the PFS time of these patients will be calculated assuming the event occurred on the date of progression (or death).

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: PFS (months) = ([Date of Event/Censoring – Date of Randomization] +1)/30.4

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: OS is defined as time from randomization to death from any cause.

evaluation_table.protocol_text: OS: the time from randomization until death due to any cause

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Death will be regarded as an event.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Overall Survival (OS): Time from randomization until death due to any cause.

issues.original_sap_text: It is noted that the primary efficacy analysis (Section 8.1) was completed in the 1st CSR. In the final CSR, the analysis for the primary efficacy endpoint will be performed as a sensitivity analysis using the same method as 1st CSR.
issues.generated_sap_text: The primary analysis of efficacy and safety is planned after all patients have completed Cycle 6 of the Induction Study Period... The primary analysis will compare the ORR between the CT-P16 and EU-Approved Avastin groups in both the ITT and PP populations.
issues.protocol_text: The sponsor plans to prepare 3 CSRs... To report data after completion of the Induction Study Period... To report all data until the end of study.
issues.why_they_conflict: The Original SAP is specifically for the Final CSR (3rd CSR) and states the primary analysis was already done in the 1st CSR. The Generated SAP is written as if it is the initial plan for the primary analysis.
issues.description: The Generated SAP fails to reflect the specific context of the Original SAP (Version 3.0 for Final CSR), treating the primary analysis as a future event rather than a completed one being repeated as sensitivity.
issues.reasoning: 1) Original SAP says primary analysis was completed in 1st CSR and will be repeated as sensitivity in Final CSR. 2) Generated SAP says primary analysis is planned after Cycle 6. 3) These conflict because the Generated SAP ignores the study status (Final CSR). 4) Both cannot be true for the same document version.

reasoning: The Generated SAP captures the core statistical methods (Logistic Regression, Kaplan-Meier, Cox Model) and endpoints (ORR, PFS, OS, TTP, Response Duration) correctly. However, it fails to reflect the specific context of the Original SAP, which is Version 3.0 for the Final CSR. The Original SAP explicitly states that the primary analysis was completed in the 1st CSR and is now a sensitivity analysis. The Generated SAP presents the primary analysis as the main planned analysis. Additionally, the Generated SAP omits detailed logic for handling incomplete dates for efficacy events and the specific requirement for a Tipping Point analysis for the primary endpoint, which are present in the Original SAP.
summary: The Generated SAP correctly identifies the efficacy endpoints and basic statistical methods but fails to capture the specific context of the Final CSR (treating the primary analysis as a sensitivity analysis). It also omits detailed date imputation logic and the tipping point analysis requirement.
